label: 籠名
本: Land, Power, and the Sacred The Estate System in Medieval Japan . University of Hawai'i Press . 2018
著者: Goodwin, Janet R. (ed.)/ Piggott, Joan R. (ed.)
説明文: “imprisoning a name.” An act of cursing whereby monks would write the name of an opponent on a piece of paper and lock it up inside their temple. Punishment by a deity was expected to ensue.
